page.title: 06A TYPICAL SUNDAY
page.content: A Typical Sunday The Harrop household starts Sunday with a fight for the bathroom. Today it is Church Parade at Christ Church so the children wear their Guide, Brownie or Cub uniform. Bob is a Sidesman so he must be early to ring the Church bell. During the service Andrea and her friend Samantha carry the Guide pennant to the altar. My friend Brenda and I are on the coffee rota today so we must organise this. Ian and Emma collect the dirty cups for washing up. Hopefully, lunch might be early as we are all going for a walk to Stokes Bay and the grassy slopes of Fort Gilkicker. When we arrive home the children will have developed good appetites. After tea we will potter in the garden or watch television until it is time for baths and bed.
